newsitem.title: JAPAN: Dlr slips on Sakakibara but recovers above 124 yen.
newsitem.headline: Dlr slips on Sakakibara but recovers above 124 yen.

text.p: *Dollar slid in late Tokyo on comments from Minister of Finance's (MOF) senior official Eisuke Sakakibara that it is possible the yen may strengthen, based on its movements over past year, and that it could strengthen to 103 yen to dollar.
*Comment set off sales which in turn triggered consecutive waves of stop-loss selling, taking dollar down briefly near 123.70 yen.
*But the dollar soon recovered to above 124 yen on buying back by interbank dealers, dealers said.
